title: River-based livelihood fair held at Shyamnagar
body: A fair focusing on river-dependent livelihoods was held on Thursday on the banks of the Kholpetua river of Shyamnagar in Satkhira district. At the fair venue at Kamalkati village of Padmapukur union, traditional fishing equipment, nets, buckets, pots, snails and oysters, and other items related to fishing community’s life and culture were exhibited. Bangladesh Resource Center for Indigenous Knowledge, Green Coalition, Kamalkati Ekota Juba Sangha, Kadbel Nari Unnayan Sangha and local communities jointly organised the fair. In the fair the exhibition of salinity-tolerant plants, which usually grow along the banks of the Kholpetua and Kapotakha rivers, such as bain, kankarda, gewaa, goran, khalisa, golpata and rice plants, caught visitors’ attention. Among the visitors, youngsters said that they enjoyed the fair as it allowed them to learn about fishing culture that rarely appear in the textbooks.
